items.title: What’s the Right Number of Taxis (or Uber or Lyft Cars) in a City?
items.abstract: Technology has made it easier to identify and manage the optimal supply, but it also depends on which problem you’re trying to solve.

items.title: Why American Giant Re-Designed Its Web Site
items.abstract: The metrics indicate the company made the right call. (Plus, the company has sold out all of its product.)

items.title: Tech Envisions the Ultimate Start-Up: An Entire City
items.abstract: Silicon Valley wants to save cities. What could go wrong?

items.title: Review: How Laws of Physics Govern Growth in Business and in Cities
items.abstract: In his new book, “Scale,” Geoffrey West, a theoretical physicist, manages to deliver a lot of theory and history accessibly and entertainingly.
keywords: Scale: The Universal Laws of Growth, Innovation, Sustainability and the Pace of Life in Organisms, Cities, Economies, and Companies (Book)

items.title: In Lieu of Money, Toyota Donates Efficiency to New York Charity
items.abstract: Toyota engineers brought kaizen, a Japanese word meaning “continuous improvement,” to the Food Bank for New York City, cutting wait times at soup kitchens and streamlining procedures.
keywords: Food Bank for New York City
